page.title: 15HOUSING
page.content: ........continued There were in fact four pockets of housing,all of a somewhat exclusive character,mainly semi-detached, set-back from the roads,with quite substantial gardens.These were : (a).the cottages at Mote End Farm, (b).housing in Hendon Wood Lane, (c).housing in Barnet Gate Lane, (d).housing in Hyver Hall. There were also some isolated farm cottages in Totteridge Lane. Indeed it could be said that the housing was concentrated at the north end of Hendon Wood and Barnet Gate Lanes at their junction with Wood Lane,a main road and bus routes between Barnet and the A1.It was generally of a straggling ribbon development on one rather than both sides of the road.
